comments:
I synch and there's a conflict.

I click on the conflict file.

I select updates on the right and click to move them to the left.

I right click in the left pane and choose "Save".

I right click on the file and choose "Update".

I get a warning message that "Usaved files will be saved."  What saved files?

The file is copied into the respository and I get an error message that "An 
error occured.  Exit workspace?"

This happens consistently with m5.

Next time, I'll take better notes.
Was the stacktrace not available from the error dialog?  Or was it in the .log?

Sorry I was in a rush to meet a deadline, so I had to compose the bug after the 
fact ... and I didn't have those details.

This does not happen to me with F2.
Instead of the warning message, I get an info dialog that says "Your changes
have been saved. When you are finished, select 'Mark as merged' to make this
file an outgoing change". 
No exceptions occour but a file called .#oldfilename, containing data identical
to the file that was in the repo (and hence to the current local file as well,
now that it has been updated to match the remote file), is created in the local
project.

My verification was performed with a .txt file in a 'simple' project, not on a
Java source file in a java project. Not sure if this would change things...
Closing, believed fix.  Please reopen if this proves false.
